newsitem.title: USA: Petrolite to sell Singapore facility. [CORRECTED 01:10 GMT 15/11]
newsitem.headline: Petrolite to sell Singapore facility. [CORRECTED 01:10 GMT 15/11]

text.p: Petrolite Corp said Wednesday its board of directors approved the sale of its Singapore facility and also approved investment in three customer service facilities in Southeast Asia. (corrects to say company is investing in customer service facilities.)
The sale will net Petrolite a $3 million gain after tax and add $4 million to its cash flow after investments in its customer service facilities, the specialty chemical company said.

The investment in the customer service facilities "will enable Petrolite to better serve its expanding revenue base in the area by moving its expertise closer to customers in each regional market and to enhance value creation opportunities," chief financial officer John Casper said in a news release.
Petrolite shares closed up 4-1/2 at 39-1/4 on Nasdaq Wednesday.
